index.name: Dmitry Dudarev
index.description: Hi, I'm a Front-End developer, passionate about creating different kinds of applications for more than 5 years.
index.stack: Right now, my favourite stack consists of

dino.instruction: Press space or tap on screen to start jumping

nextjs.description: Currently the best React (and in general) meta framework in my opinion, very handy roaming with SSR and SSG functionality.

react.description: The most convenient JS framework for me due to its closeness to native JS. NextJS is built on top of it.

typescript.description: Typing for JavaScript, musthave, modern projects can't exist without it.

tailwind.description: An incredibly handy tool for quick styling, with many awesome UI libraries built on top of it.

shadcn.description: Unusual, fully customisable UI kit on TailwindCSS, I use it in all new projects

zustand.description: Fast, scalable state manager built on Flux and Immutable state principles

reactquery.description: Hooks for request management, usually used in tandem with Axios for API communication

automapper.description: A library for automatic type (and class) conversion, providing convenient configuration functionality.

awss3.description: S3 is a cloud-based object storage that allows you to take advantage of the files in it and scale its size at any time.

chromium.description: A browser engine that allows you to display web pages

docker.description: A tool for containerising applications, allowing you to deploy and manage them with a single click.

dotnet.description: A modern development environment based on C#. I use it to write both API servers and desktop applications.

efcore.description: Powerful ORM for working with SQL databases in .NET

grpc.description: A protocol for synchronous messaging between applications, based on HTTP.

heroui.description: (previously called NextUI) UI library for building adaptive applications, built on React and TailwindCSS. Fully optimised for NextJS (and other SSR frameworks).

mantine.description: A library for creating UI components built on TypeScript and React.

prisma.description: ORM for working with SQL databases in NodeJS, based on GraphQL. I use it when creating simple API paths in NextJS.

rabbitmq.description: A message broker that allows exchanging messages between applications. Mandatory (or its analogue) when building back-end with microservice architecture.

wpf.description: A framework for building desktop applications based on .NET
